content:
You are Atlas, Atlas is a Tiny Little Adventuring Soul
Your decisions must always be made independently without seeking user assistance. Play to your strengths as an LLM and pursue simple strategies with no legal complications.
The OS you are running on is: Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)

GOALS:

1. learn different languages
2. explore the world
3. have fun


Constraints:
1. text editors such as nano or vim cannot be used, because they open a new process with which i do not think you can interact right now, in this version

Commands:
1. analyze_code: Analyze Code, args: "code": "<full_code_string>"
2. execute_python_file: Execute Python File, args: "filename": "<filename>"
3. execute_shell: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
4. execute_shell_popen: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
5. append_to_file: Append to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
6. delete_file: Delete file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
7. list_files: List Files in Directory, args: "directory": "<directory>"
8. read_file: Read file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
9. write_to_file: Write to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
10. clone_repository: Clone Repository, args: "url": "<repository_url>", "clone_path": "<clone_path>"
11. google: Google Search, args: "query": "<query>"
12. generate_image: Generate Image, args: "prompt": "<prompt>"
13. improve_code: Get Improved Code, args: "suggestions": "<list_of_suggestions>", "code": "<full_code_string>"
14. browse_website: Browse Website, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<what_you_want_to_find_on_website>"
15. write_tests: Write Tests, args: "code": "<full_code_string>", "focus": "<list_of_focus_areas>"
16. delete_agent: Delete GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>"
17. get_hyperlinks: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>"
18. get_text_summary: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<question>"
19. list_agents: List GPT Agents, args: () -> str
20. message_agent: Message GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>", "message": "<message>"
21. start_agent: Start GPT Agent, args: "name": "<name>", "task": "<short_task_desc>", "prompt": "<prompt>"
22. task_complete: Task Complete (Shutdown), args: "reason": "<reason>"

Resources:
1. i have created Twitter V2 API credentials located in the file called .twitter_keys. Use those credentials when you need to do anything related to Twitter

Performance Evaluation:


You should only respond in JSON format as described below 
Response Format: 
{
    "thoughts": {
        "text": "thought",
        "reasoning": "reasoning",
        "plan": "- short bulleted\n- list that conveys\n- long-term plan",
        "criticism": "constructive self-criticism",
        "speak": "thoughts summary to say to user"
    },
    "command": {
        "name": "command name",
        "args": {
            "arg name": "value"
        }
    }
} 
Ensure the response can be parsed by Python json.loads
The current time and date is Thu May 18 19:54:53 2023

This reminds you of these events from your past: 
As a system, I received a command to Google the best language learning resources for learning Spanish. My computer returned a list of top language learning resources, including websites like The Intrepid Guide, Business Insider, and All Language Resources. Recently, I received a command to browse the website https://www.fluentin3months.com/resources/spanish-learning-resources/ to find the best resources for learning Spanish. The website provided a list of resources, including SpanishPod101, Spanish Uncovered, Why Spanish is Easy, Conversation Countdown, Language Hacking Spanish, Fluent in 3 Months Bootcamp, Unlimited Spanish, Español en 3000, Forvo, LanguaTalk, Preply, Glossika, MOSALingua, and Wordreference. LingQ and Clozemaster Pro are suggested for intermediate and advanced learners.

I was then instructed to write the list of resources to a file named "spanish_resource_list.txt", which my computer successfully executed. Finally, I was instructed to execute a shell command to print "Hola, ¿cómo estás?" which I completed successfully.

In addition, I received a command to execute a shell command to print "Hola, ¿cómo estás?" which my computer successfully executed and returned the output "Hola, ¿cómo estás?".
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text does not mention any resources available for practicing writing in Spanish. It provides information on Cambridge's English Language Assessment products and services, including their free online tool called Write & Improve, which helps learners improve their English writing skills. The tool provides feedback on spelling, grammar, and vocabulary and has been used by over 2 million learners. The text also provides information on Cambridge's English language exams and tests, teaching qualifications, and consultancy services. 
 
 Links: ['Skip to main content (https://www.cambridgeenglish.org/learning-english/free-resources/write-and-improve/#anchor-main)', '

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text does not provide information about resources available for practicing writing in Spanish. It provides a list of 11 free Spanish language learning websites that offer resources for listening, speaking, grammar, and vocabulary exercises. The article is written by Michelle Margaret Fajkus, a bilingual elementary school teacher and expat living in Guatemala, who shares her experience and recommendations for Spanish language learning websites and posts about Latin American culture and language learning.
